item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3445)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S3445)

summary.text: Senior Oversight Committee Extension Act of 2008 - Directs the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to jointly: (1) take whatever actions are appropriate, including the allocation of appropriate personnel, funding, and other resources, to continue until September 30, 2011, the operations of the Senior Oversight Committee jointly established by those secretaries to address concerns related to the treatment of wounded, ill, and injured members of the Armed Forces and veterans; and (2) report to Congress on the advisability of continuing the committee after that date.

bill.title: Senior Oversight Committee Extension Act of 2008

item.title: Senior Oversight Committee Extension Act of 2008
Senior Oversight Committee Extension Act of 2008
A bill to provide for a three-year extension of the Senior Oversight Committee on wounded warrior matters, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3445)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
